# reshape2 - tutorial

[back to the main page](../index.html)

***

In fact there are only two functions worth mentioning: *dcast*, which is equivalent to MS Excel pivot table, and *melt*, which does the opposite or unpivots a table.

```{r}
library(reshape2)

d <- data.frame(konto = paste(rep(7, 9), 1:9, sep=""),
                styczen = rnorm(9, 10, 1),
                luty = rnorm(9, 10, 2),
                marzec = rnorm(9, 10, 3))
d
```
***
Transormation into a normalized table:
```{r}
dn <- melt(d, "konto", variable.name = "miesiac", value.name = "przychody")
head(dn)
tail(dn)
```
***
And back to the previous format using a pivot:
```{r}
dcast(dn, konto ~ miesiac, value.var = "przychody")
```
